types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the Milestone Course.

fields.name: AddResourceToQueue
fields.description: Adds a resource to the queue of content for the current user so it can be viewed at a later time. Returns true if the content has been successfully added. The user must be given access to the course before it can be added to their queue. The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

args.name: resourceId
args.description: The ID for the resource that is to be added to the queue of the current user. For example, this could be a course ID that the user would like to view at a later time.

args.name: resourceType
args.description: The type of content that is to be added to the queue of the current user.

fields.name: ArchiveUserCourse
fields.description: Archives a user's access to a course. The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

args.name: id
args.description: The ID of the course to be archived.

fields.name: ArchiveUserLearningPath
fields.description: The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

fields.name: CreateAssessmentAttempt
fields.description: Creates an assessment attempt for a course assessment. This is used to create a super quiz attempt with user's selected questions. The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

args.name: courseId
args.description: The ID of the Course.

args.name: questions
args.description: The questions user selected for super quiz.

args.name: topicId
args.description: The ID of the Topic.

fields.name: CreateAssignmentSubmission
fields.description: Creates an assignment submission. This is used when user works on a manually graded assessment, the assessment attempt will be associated with the assignment submission. The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

args.name: asset
args.description: The URL of the asset.

args.name: assignment
args.description: The ID of the assignment.

args.name: body
args.description: The body of the assignment submission.

args.name: course
args.description: The ID of the course.

args.name: quizAttempt
args.description: The ID of the assessment attempt.

args.name: videoAsset
args.description: The URL of the video asset.

fields.name: CreateCertificateFromUpload
fields.description: The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

fields.name: CreateComment
fields.description: Creates a comment. The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

args.name: asset
args.description: The URL of the asset.

args.name: assetFileName
args.description: The file name of the asset.

args.name: body
args.description: The body of the comment.

args.name: clientId
args.description: The ID of the Client.

args.name: commentableId
args.description: The ID of the commentable entity.

args.name: commentableType
args.description: The type of the comment's parent thread, based on the comment's location, e.g. discussion board, assignment, widget thread etc.

args.name: notificationsEnabled
args.description: Flag to enable notifications.

args.name: parentId
args.description: The ID of the parent comment.

args.name: videoAsset
args.description: The ID of the video asset.

fields.name: CreateCommentLike
fields.description: Adds a like to a comment. The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

args.name: clientId
args.description: The ID of the Client.

args.name: commentId
args.description: The ID of the Comment.

args.name: commentableId
args.description: The ID of the commentable entity.

args.name: commentableType
args.description: The type of thread, based on the thread's location, e.g. discussion board, assignment, widget thread etc.

fields.name: CreateInPersonEvent
fields.description: The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

fields.name: CreateLearner
fields.description: The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

args.name: clientId
args.description: The ID of the Client.

fields.name: CreateLearners
fields.description: The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

fields.name: CreateLearningPath
fields.description: The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

args.name: clientId
args.description: The ID of the Client.

fields.name: CreateThread
fields.description: Creates a thread of comments under a commentable type. The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

args.name: asset
args.description: The URL of the asset.

fields.name: CreateUnansweredAssessmentAttempt
fields.description: Creates an assessment attempt for unanswered questions. This is used when user skips questions during an assessment attempt and decides to review the unanswered questions. The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

fields.name: Login
fields.description: Attempts to login the user. The mutation will perform a number of checks such as password validity and email verification status. If successful, the user will be logged in and an authentication token returned. If not, an appropriate error will be provided. The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

args.name: email
args.description: The email of the Current User attempting to log in.

args.name: password
args.description: The password of the Current User attempting to log in.

fields.name: Logout
fields.description: The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

fields.name: MergeAssessmentAttemptIntoComplete
fields.description: Merges an assessment attempt into the last completed assessment attempt. This is used after user finishes reviewing the unanswered questions, the current assessment attempt will be merged to the last completed assessment attempt. The results of this mutation can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

args.name: assessmentAttemptId
args.description: The ID of the Assessment Attempt.

fields.name: CatalogContent
fields.description: Returns catalog content items and meta data matching with the criterias. The results of this query can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation. This query has an additional cost of 3 points.

args.name: contentTypes
args.description: The list of content types to be queried.

args.name: labels
args.description: The list of aggregation labels. The order of list items will match with argument `labels`. Labels are custom fields.

args.name: page
args.description: The page number to return within the collection.

args.name: query
args.description: The search query.

args.name: resultsDisplayType
args.description: The display type. Defaults to the value configured for catalog from the user's Thought Industries instance. If the catalog is not configured, it falls back to value `grid`. When the value is `calendar`, it overrides the values for argument `sortColumn` to be `displayDate` and `sortDirection` to be `asc`.

args.name: sortColumn
args.description: The content data column used to sort the collection. Defaults to the value configured for catalog from the user's Thought Industries instance. If the catalog is not configured, it falls back to value `createdAt`. When the value is `relevance`, it requires the argument `query` also to be set, or it falls back to value `courseStartDate`.

args.name: sortDirection
args.description: The direction used to sort the collection. Defaults to the value configured for catalog from the user's Thought Industries instance. If the catalog is not configured, it falls back to value `desc`. When the argument `sortColumn` is `relevance`, it requires the argument `query` also to be set, or it falls back to value `desc`.

args.name: token
args.description: The secure catalog query. The value is encoded by the secret key of user's Thought Industries instance.

args.name: values
args.description: The list of aggregation values. The order of list items will match with argument `values`. Values are custom fields.

args.name: user
args.description: The ID of the User.

fields.name: CompanyTranslations
fields.description: Returns translations from the user's Thought Industries instance.

args.name: namespace
args.description: The namespace is used to specify the content category for the translations. Accepts values of `lms` for platform content and `emails` for email content.

fields.description: The results of this query can be affected by providing an authToken header to set a user for the operation.

args.name: courseId

types.name: RusticiCourseLaunchResponse
types.description: Contains data to launch SCORM content through Rustici API.

fields.name: courseTitle
fields.description: The title of the Topic Or Course.

fields.name: fullscreenEmbed
fields.description: Informs the client whether the SCORM content should be launched in full screen or windowed.

fields.name: height
fields.description: The height of the container to launch the SCORM content. This is only applicable for Topic when the topic has configured the `Height` option. Defaults to `680px` for both pop-ups and embedded SCORM files.

fields.name: isRusticiCourse
fields.description: Flag to indicate a Course entity in Rustici API.

fields.name: registrationCheckerEndpoint
fields.description: The endpoint to check completion status for the current user registration. This requires a `POST` method and request body with JWT. Example curl request: `curl --location --request POST '<registrationCheckerEndpoint>' --header 'Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded' --data-urlencode 'jwt=<registrationCheckerJWT>'`

fields.name: registrationCheckerJWT
fields.description: The JWT to check completion status for the current user registration.

fields.name: registrationId
fields.description: The ID of user registration in Rustici API.

fields.name: url
fields.description: The URL to launch SCORM content.

fields.name: width
fields.description: The width of the container to launch the SCORM content. This is only applicable for Topic when the topic has configured the `Width` option. Defaults to `1000px` for pop-ups, and 100% for embedded SCORM files.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of the Rustici Launch.

fields.name: displayAllHints
fields.description: Display all hints. This is only applicable when all the Quizzes have the `Display all Hints` option enabled.

fields.description: Disables navigation during quiz. This is only applicable when all the Quizzes have the `Disable Navigation During Quiz` option enabled.

fields.description: Allows learner to skip questions. This is only applicable when all the selected Quizzes have the `Allow Learner to Skip Questions` option enabled.

fields.description: The estimated time per question. This is only applicable when all the Quizzes have the `Estimated Time Per Question` option enabled and use the same value.

fields.name: timerEnabled
fields.description: Enables timer. This is only applicable when all the Quizzes have the `Enable Timer` option enabled.

fields.name: totalTimeInSeconds
fields.description: The total estimated time for all of the Quiz questions. This is only applicable when all the Quizzes have the `Estimated Time Per Question` option enabled.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
